alert.note: Alert for Graham (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 21 at 9:17PM MST until August 23 at 4:00PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Arizona... Gila River near Solomon affecting Graham County. .Heavy rain has led to a rapid rises on the Gila River. This update includes new data on a lower measurement in Virden that is expected to drop the crest at the Gila River near Solomon from 21 to 20.5 ft. For the Upper Gila...including Gila River near Solomon...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Gila River near Solomon. * WHEN...Until Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, Agricultural flooding begins from Solomon down to Thatcher. Water begins to threaten bridge approaches in the Safford Valley. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM MST Sunday the stage was 12.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 20.5 feet early tomorrow afternoon. - Action stage is 19.0 feet. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday morning at 915 AM MST.
